description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 3.1 Child Protection EnvironmentPolicies, legal and administrative frameworks for protecting children from all forms of violence and for ensuring their access to protection services, including to justice, are strengthened and harmonized with the international treaties, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Human Rights Institutions, Justice For Children, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: PCR3 Keep Children SafeChildren's rights to protection are respected, protected and fulfilled in all private and public spaces.

mailing-address.narrative: Plot 9 George Street PO Box 7047 Kampala

System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 3.1 Child Protection EnvironmentPolicies, legal and administrative frameworks for protecting children from all forms ofviolence and for ensuring their access to protection services, including to justice, are strengthened and harmonized with theinternational treaties
of planned, relevant,and appropriate laws, regulations, policies,sectoral plans integrating provisions on children's rights to protection.
A National Action Plan on Violence Against Children is approved by the MGLSD by 2012 and it is progressively being implemented all over the country by 2014

actual.value: 2015:National Action Plan on Violence against Children in Schools launched by the Minister of Education in August 2015, together with the Guidelines for Reporting Tracking Referral and Response (RTRR) for VACiS. The plan and guideline disseminated in all regions and being implemented in 10 pilot district

title.narrative: Mapping of the child protection system in Uganda completed and findings used to develop a Child Protection Strategy by 2014
Availability of tested innovative approaches for reduction of child marriage

target.value: 2015:National Strategy for abandonment of child marriage approved by the MGLSD

actual.value: 2015:National Strategy to end child marriage and teenage pregnancy launched on 16 June 2015 by the Hon Minister for Gender Labour and Social Development.
